Package org.jnetpcap

Class PcapUtils

java.lang.Object
org.jnetpcap.PcapUtils
public final class PcapUtils extends Object
A Pcap utility class which provides certain additional and convenience methods.
Since:
1.2
Author:
Mark Bednarczyk, Sly Technologies, Inc.

  • Method Details

    • dispatchInBackground

      public static <T> PcapTask<T> dispatchInBackground(Pcap pcap, int cnt, ByteBufferHandler<T> handler, T data)
      Runs the dispatch function in a background thread. The function returns immediately and returns a PcapTask from which the user can interact with the background task.
      Type Parameters:
      T - User supplied type
      Parameters:
      pcap - an open pcap object
      cnt - number of packets to capture and exit, 0 for infinate
      handler - user supplied callback handler
      data - opaque, user supplied data object dispatched back to the handler
      Returns:
      a task object which allows interaction with the underlying capture loop and thread

    • dispatchInBackground

      public static <T> PcapTask<T> dispatchInBackground(Pcap pcap, int cnt, JBufferHandler<T> handler, T data)
      Runs the dispatch function in a background thread. The function returns immediately and returns a PcapTask from which the user can interact with the background task.
      Type Parameters:
      T - user supplied type
      Parameters:
      pcap - an open pcap object
      cnt - number of packets to capture and exit, 0 for infinate
      handler - user supplied callback handler
      data - opaque, user supplied data object dispatched back to the handler
      Returns:
      a task object which allows interaction with the underlying capture loop and thread

    • getHardwareAddress

      public static byte[] getHardwareAddress(PcapIf netif) throws IOException
      Retrieves a network hardware address or MAC for a network interface.
      Parameters:
      netif - network device as retrieved from Pcap.findAllDevs().
      Returns:
      network interface hardware address or null if unable to retrieve it
      Throws:
      IOException - any communication errors
      See Also:
      • Pcap.findAllDevs(List, StringBuilder)

    • getHardwareAddress

      public static byte[] getHardwareAddress(String device) throws IOException
      Retrieves a network hardware address or MAC for a network interface.
      Parameters:
      device - network interface name
      Returns:
      network interface hardware address or null if unable to retrieve it
      Throws:
      IOException - any communication errors

    • loopInBackground

      public static <T> PcapTask<T> loopInBackground(Pcap pcap, int cnt, ByteBufferHandler<T> handler, T data)

    • loopInBackground

      public static <T> PcapTask<T> loopInBackground(Pcap pcap, int cnt, JBufferHandler<T> handler, T data)
      Runs the loop function in a background thread. The function returns immediately and returns a PcapTask from which the user can interact with the background task.

    • injectLoop

      public static <T> int injectLoop(int cnt, int id, PcapPacketHandler<T> handler, T user, PcapPacket packet)
      Inject loop.
      Type Parameters:
      T - user supplied type
      Parameters:
      cnt - number of packets
      id - dlt type
      handler - user packet handler
      user - user object
      packet - packet used for peering when using no copy mode
      Returns:
      libpcap result code
